headline: Paramount CEO slams Netflix as Warner Bros. takeover case heats up
summary: Some people view movies as simple entertainment, a fun way to spend free time and relax. Others see them as much more than that: stories carefully brought to life in a wondrously vivid way. Almost like magic. I belong to the second group, believing that movies can use the "seventh art" to ...

headline: Netflix Stock Tanks 39% — Is It Too Cheap to Ignore?
summary: Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) won the streaming wars that exploded after the pandemic, outlasting a surge of competitors to stand as the only major service delivering consistent profits. While rivals like Disney (NYSE:DIS) bled red ink, Netflix grew subscribers to over 325 million paid memberships and boosted margins through ad tiers and password crackdowns. But this dominance ... Netflix Stock Tanks 39% — Is It Too Cheap to Ignore?

headline: Issa Rae shares the simple exercise she uses twice a year to set herself up for success—it includes pens, lists and a 'superpower day'
summary: Issa Rae writes down her ideas and goals in a notebook on New Year's Day, and revisits them six months later, to stay on track for achieving them, she says.

headline: Automakers largely sit out 2026 Super Bowl advertising amid industry uncertainty
summary: Automakers are largely sitting on the advertising sidelines during this year's Super Bowl amid broader uncertainty in the U.S. automotive industry.

raw.headline: Automakers largely sit out 2026 Super Bowl advertising amid industry uncertainty

headline: Netflix Antitrust Scrutiny Meets Valuation And Momentum Questions For Investors
summary: Netflix is facing active U.S. Department of Justice antitrust investigations into its proposed acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery. Senate hearings are examining whether the deal could reduce competition in streaming and content production. Regulators are also probing whether Netflix has engaged in exclusionary conduct ahead of the transaction. For investors watching NasdaqGS:NFLX, this scrutiny comes at a time when the stock is trading around $82.2, with a 3 year return of 136.6% and a 5...

headline: Netflix Faces DOJ Antitrust Heat Over Nearly $83 Billion Warner Bros. Deal As Regulators Question Market Power Grab: Report
summary: The Justice Department is scrutinizing Netflix's nearly $83 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery assets over concerns the deal could entrench market power, even as Netflix disputes monopoly risks and its shares rose modestly.
